Notes: Unique internal/provider identifier. Often correlates with VIN but is not guaranteed to match.
Listing title, usually combining Year, Make, Model, and Trim.
Full marketing description, vehicle features, and dealership notes.
Direct link to the vehicle details page on the dealership website.
The vehicle manufacturer.
The specific vehicle model name.
The manufacturing model year.
The numeric odometer reading.
The unit of measurement for distance (usually Miles).
URL for the primary vehicle photograph.
Label associated with the primary image.
Description of the gearbox type.
The energy source used by the engine.
The vehicle's body classification.
The drivetrain configuration (AWD, FWD, RWD).
The unique 17-character Vehicle Identification Number.
The general state of the vehicle (New or Used).
Original/list price. The "compare-to" number (often MSRP for new, list for used).
The full physical address of the dealership.
The manufacturer's name for the vehicle's paint color.
Current asking price after discounts. May include/exclude incentives based on rules.
The current sales availability status.
Specific sales category (NEW, USED, or CPO).
Geographic North-South coordinate of the dealership location.
Geographic East-West coordinate of the dealership location.
The specific feature package or trim level.
Unique ID for the dealership's Facebook page.
Street address portion of the location.
City of the vehicle's location.
Country of the vehicle's location.
A comma-separated list of all available image URLs.
The name of the selling dealership.
Unique internal identifier for the dealership.
The internal stock number assigned by the dealer for inventory tracking.
Days since the listing record was created or last reset by the provider/feed.
